title: Christian Communism, Iconoclasm, Heaven and Earth, Discussing SSM in Christian School
description:
You can find the written questions on the Discord server https://discord.gg/DPCa7FCh

0:00:55  Intro
0:02:50  Can PVK talk about toolmakers paradigm?
0:04:30  How could today’s church be faithful to Acts communitarian nature of descriptive not prescriptive?
0:28:45  Is there an unified message about physical and spiritual worship (high places in Hebrew worship vs iconoclasm)?
0:45:20  What about Dostoevsky’s writing about that if a nation loses belief in God (atheism), it ceases to be a nation?
1:01:05  Trophies were won by merit, now participation trophies, next probably proposition trophies; how would it look like?
1:02:05  What are PVK’s thoughts on Junipero Serra controversy?
1:05:35  Aren’t we doomed by our own post modern analysis, until we talk more about individuals rather than society?
1:11:05  What’s more real: the cupness of the cup or the cup and how does that relate to the Incarnation?
1:15:45  Reply by Althaus about why culture isn’t celebrating religious conservatives for being rebels
1:17:35  Is it good to fight against deconstruction, while it could lead to an unlikely restoration of Christianity? 
1:26:05  What makes a moral system successful?
1:29:25  What’re PVK’s thoughts on the legacy of John Shelby Spong?
1:31:30  Do seemingly contradicting stories in the Bible mean this stuff was never meant to be figured out and pinned down?
1:34:20  New religious movements have no conception of failures from humanity’s past
1:37:20  Is the condemning attitude among Christians giving the homosexual community the right to be angry?
2:08:20  Is not having children a sin?
2:13:00  Caller remark: Failing the ideal of Jesus, is not a reason to be condemned 
2:15:25  Closing remarks / End of transmission
